result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard A. Burns Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours community service per week.
Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior authorization.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
AODA w/ follow up.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A. Burns Jr.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Case Called: 1:21 pm 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person with Atty Tina Abernethy-Mays.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 2 (Possess Methamphetamine Precursors)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA and follow through; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
COURT finds the def entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked.
